title: 17 Perfect Valentine‚Äôs Day Manicures, From Coquette To Plain Pink
description: As far as classic accents go, tiny red or pink hearts make for a fun manicure any time of year, not just the first week of February. But seeing as we‚Äôre heading into Valentine‚Äôs Day season, we have a few ideas to level it up. Our favorite manicures of the moment are loosely inspired by Cupid, flowers and all things love. But just like the poppy-red Sezane cardigan in your wardrobe, these nail looks are timeless and a little flirty.¬† From a glossy black manicure with heart details to kitschy coquette nails, we‚Äôve compiled the coolest Valentine‚Äôs Day nail art, ahead. DashDividers_1_500x100 Coquette Nails View this post on Instagram A post shared by Melanie Graves (@overglowedit) Pink ribbons, bow charms, and anything loosely Sandy Liang-inspired goes for coquette nails. DashDividers_1_500x100 Pink 3D Jelly View this post on Instagram A post shared by Celebrity Manicurist & Educator (@julieknailsnyc) A surprising trend for 2025? Jelly everything. Take your nail art inspiration from this look by celebrity manicurist Julie K, who used pink chrome polish topped with 3D Zig Zag Gel from Japanese gel brand Jello Jello. DashDividers_1_500x100 Black Heart View this post on Instagram A post shared by Iram Shelton (@iramshelton) If pink and red feels too obvious, go for a glossy black manicure and a subtle heart outline. Throw in a teeny gemstone for sparkle. DashDividers_1_500x100 Pink + Red View this post on Instagram A post shared by Jess BrushüíÖüèª (@nail.betch) Although, this pink and red combo is chic without being precious. DashDividers_1_500x100 Chrome Hearts View this post on Instagram A post shared by Zola Ganzorigt (@nailsbyzola) If you can‚Äôt go full coquette, go for a chrome ‚Äî or vanilla glazed donut ‚Äî manicure with some hand-painted hearts on top. DashDividers_1_500x100 Gemstone French View this post on Instagram A post shared by Sarah Haidar (@heluviee) If you have access to gemstones, you might as well go all out with a cut-out heart embroidery-style design. DashDividers_1_500x100 Velvet Hearts View this post on Instagram A post shared by WhoDidHerNails (@whodidhernails) Velvet, glass, or cat-eye polish is fun on its own, but add hearts to take it up a notch. DashDividers_1_500x100 Pink Shimmer View this post on Instagram A post shared by stephanie stone (@stephstonenails) If you have a light pink polish and a glitter polish at home, you can DIY this adorable pixie dust-inspired V-Day manicure. DashDividers_1_500x100 White Hot View this post on Instagram A post shared by NAILS OF LA (@nails_of_la) A perfect complement to the chunky silver Tiffany tag bracelet they‚Äôve hopefully bought for you. DashDividers_1_500x100 Red French View this post on Instagram A post shared by GLOSSLAB (@glosslab) Looking for something simple? Go for a French manicure and make the tip red instead of white. DashDividers_1_500x100 Cherry Bomb View this post on Instagram A post shared by ùôèùô§ùô¢ ùòΩùôñùôòùôùùôûùô† Nails (@tombachik) Try nail stickers ‚Äî like these from Le Mini Macron ‚Äî with cherries and kisses. DashDividers_1_500x100 Heart French View this post on Instagram A post shared by IMARNI (@imarninails) For another take on a French manicure, ask for the tip to be adapted into a bowed heart shape. DashDividers_1_500x100 Baby Hearts View this post on Instagram A post shared by Vanity Projects (@vanityprojects) Teeny tiny hearts over an otherwise-neutral manicure look so sweet. DashDividers_1_500x100 Red Jellies View this post on Instagram A post shared by GLOSSLAB (@glosslab) To take the jelly trend a little less literally, go for a sheer, jellied red polish. It‚Äôs giving red Jolly Rancher. DashDividers_1_500x100 Ombre French View this post on Instagram A post shared by Alison ‚Ä¢ nailsbyalsn (@nailsbyalsn) This pink marshmallow manicure hits the tone. DashDividers_1_500x100 Hand-Painted Florals View this post on Instagram A post shared by Vanity Projects (@vanityprojects) If you‚Äôre seeing a professional, consider going full bouquet. DashDividers_1_500x100 French + Heart Accents View this post on Instagram A post shared by GLOSSLAB (@glosslab) If you‚Äôre a classic French manicure stan, just add some hearts to a few fingernails. It begs for a mirror selfie. Like what you see? author: Megan Decker
excerpt: From the red French manicure to a minimalist bare nail with teeny hearts, check out the coolest Valentine's Day nail art.

html:
As far as classic accents go, tiny red or pink hearts make for a fun manicure any time of year, not just the first week of February. But seeing as we're heading into Valentine's Day season, we have a few ideas to level it up.

From a glossy black manicure with heart details to kitschy coquette nails, we've compiled the coolest Valentine's Day nail art, ahead.

AdvertisementADVERTISEMENT

Coquette Nails

Pink ribbons, bow charms, and anything loosely Sandy Liang-inspired goes for coquette nails.

Pink 3D Jelly

A surprising trend for 2025? Jelly everything. Take your nail art inspiration from this look by celebrity manicurist Julie K, who used pink chrome polish topped with 3D Zig Zag Gel from Japanese gel brand Jello Jello.

Black Heart

If pink and red feels too obvious, go for a glossy black manicure and a subtle heart outline. Throw in a teeny gemstone for sparkle.

Pink + Red

Although, this pink and red combo is chic without being precious.

Chrome Hearts

Gemstone French

If you have access to gemstones, you might as well go all out with a cut-out heart embroidery-style design.

Velvet Hearts

Pink Shimmer

White Hot

Red French

Looking for something simple? Go for a French manicure and make the tip red instead of white.

Cherry Bomb

Try nail stickers ‚Äî like these from Le Mini Macron ‚Äî with cherries and kisses.

AdvertisementADVERTISEMENT

Heart French

Baby Hearts

Teeny tiny hearts over an otherwise-neutral manicure look so sweet.

Red Jellies

To take the jelly trend a little less literally, go for a sheer, jellied red polish. It's giving red Jolly Rancher.

Ombre French

This pink marshmallow manicure hits the tone.

Hand-Painted Florals

If you're seeing a professional, consider going full bouquet.

French + Heart Accents

If you're a classic French manicure stan, just add some hearts to a few fingernails. It begs for a mirror selfie.

AdvertisementADVERTISEMENT
